content.text: Lot requirements.

Minimum lot area per dwelling unit: 50,000 square
feet.

Minimum lot width and length of street line frontage:
150 feet.
Minimum depth of lot: 150 feet.
Yards, courts and open spaces.
Minimum front yard: 50 feet. On a corner lot, a front yard should be provided on each street. (See § 240-54.)
Minimum side yards: 35 feet for each side yard.
Minimum rear yard: 50 feet.

A rear yard shall be provided on a corner lot,
and the owner shall have the privilege of electing which yard is to
be the rear yard.

An unattached accessory building not over one
story or 15 feet in height and located on the rear 1/3 of the lot
may be placed at a minimum distance of five feet from the property
line. On a corner lot, such accessory building shall not be located
nearer to the street line than the required minimum front yard setback
for the zoning district.
Minimum courts: as required by § 240-55.

Usable open space, in square feet per dwelling
unit: 1,200.
Floor area. Minimum first floor area, in square feet.
One story: 2,100.
One and one-half stories: 1,800.
Two and one-half stories: 1,500.
Maximum heights.
In stories: 2 1/2.
In feet: 35.
Off-street parking spaces. As required by § 240-75 through 240-78.

Lot coverage. No buildings, accessory structures,
pools, courts, drives or paved areas shall be erected or installed
to exceed a lot coverage of 35%.[Added 7-17-1996 by L.L. No. 14-1996]
Maximum size. See § 240-59.1.[Added 1-8-2003 by L.L. No. 1-2003]

paras.title: Maximum size of one- or two-family homes.

content.text:
Definitions. As used in this section, the following
terms shall have the meanings indicated:

Maximum permitted total square footage and floor area
ratio.

The maximum permitted total square footage of
all of the buildings on a lot shall be the greater of:

The maximum total square footage allowed for a lot when applying the maximum floor area ratio for that lot plus any additional square footage to which the lot may be entitled under Subsection B(3) of this section; or
The average.

The maximum floor area ratio for a lot shall
be determined by the following chart:
Lot Size: 1,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .55000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 550.00
Lot Size: 2,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .55000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 1100.00
Lot Size: 3,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .55000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 1650.00
Lot Size: 4,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .55000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 2200.00
Lot Size: 5,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .55000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 2750.00
Lot Size: 6,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .55000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 3300.00
Lot Size: 7,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .52000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 3640.00
Lot Size: 8,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .49000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 3920.00

Lot Size: 14,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .35000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 4900.00
Lot Size: 15,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .33400  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5110.00
Lot Size: 16,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .32000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5120.00
Lot Size: 17,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .31000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5270.00
Lot Size: 18,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .30000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5400.00
Lot Size: 19,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .29000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5510.00
Lot Size: 20,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .28100  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5620.00
Lot Size: 21,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .27250  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5722.50
Lot Size: 22,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .26500  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5830.00
Lot Size: 23,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .25820  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 5938.60
Lot Size: 24,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .25200  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6048.00
Lot Size: 25,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .24600  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6150.00
Lot Size: 26,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .24070  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6279.00
Lot Size: 27,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .23200  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6264.00
Lot Size: 28,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .22760  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6372.80
Lot Size: 29,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .22350  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6481.50
Lot Size: 30,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .21960  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6588.00
Lot Size: 31,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .21600  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6696.00
Lot Size: 32,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .21250  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6800.00
Lot Size: 33,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .21000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 6930.00
Lot Size: 34,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .20750  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 7055.00
Lot Size: 35,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .20500  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 7175.00
Lot Size: 36,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .20375  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 7335.00
Lot Size: 37,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .20250  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 7492.50
Lot Size: 38,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .20125  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 7647.50
Lot Size: 39,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .20000  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 7800.00
Lot Size: 40,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19875  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 7950.00
Lot Size: 41,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19815  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 8124.15
Lot Size: 42,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19755 Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 8297.10
Lot Size: 43,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19695  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 8968.85
Lot Size: 44,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19635  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 8639.40
Lot Size: 45,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19575  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 8808.75
Lot Size: 46,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19545  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 8990.70
Lot Size: 47,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19485  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 9352.80
Lot Size: 48,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19485  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 9352.80
Lot Size: 49,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19455  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 9532.95
Lot Size: 50,000  Maximum Floor Area Ratio: .19425  Aggregate Floor Area of all of the Buildings on the lot: 9712.50

The maximum permitted total square footage for a lot whose size lies between the lot sizes shown in Column 2 of any two adjacent rows on the chart contained in Subsection B(2) of this section shall be equal to:

The maximum total square footage set forth in
Column 4 of that chart for the lot referred to in Column 2 of the
lower numbered row; plus

Ten square feet for each 100 square feet (or
part thereof) by which the lot exceeds the size of the lot referred
to in Column 2 of the lower numbered row.

The maximum permitted total square footage for
any lot whose size is greater than 50,000 square feet shall be 9,712.50
square feet plus 10 square feet for each 100 square feet (or part
thereof) by which the size of such lot exceeds 50,000 square feet.
Under no circumstances, however, shall the maximum permitted total
square footage for any lot exceed 15,000 square feet.
The average.

If an applicant wishes to obtain a building
permit which will result in the subject property having buildings
whose aggregate total square footage exceeds the maximum permitted
total square footage allowed for the subject property, the applicant
can compute the average.

To determine the average, the applicant shall
identify all of the comparison parcels by measuring the comparison
distance from each of the lot lines of the subject property using
the scale on the tax assessment map of the Town; compute the total
square footage of all of the buildings on each of the Comparison Parcels
by using the records of the Town's Building Department (If the records
of the Town's Building Department do not contain sufficient information
to determine the total square footage of all of the buildings on any
comparison parcel, the applicant shall use the records of the Town's
Assessor in order to make that determination); add the total square
footage of all the buildings on all of the comparison parcels and
divide that sum by the number of comparison parcels.

The applicant's computation of the average shall
be given to the Town's Building Department. It shall be in writing
and shall consist of a list of all of the comparison parcels identified
by their street addresses and their tax block and lot designations
on the Town's tax assessment map; the number of buildings on each
comparison parcel; the total square footage of all of the buildings
on each comparison parcel, the sum of the total square footage of
all of the buildings on all of the comparison parcels; and the average.
The applicant's architect or engineer shall certify the accuracy of
the computation of the average. If there is no architect or engineer,
the accuracy of the computation of the average shall be verified under
oath by the applicant.

If the average is a figure that exceeds what the maximum permitted total square footage for all of the buildings on the Subject Property would be when applying Subsection B of this section, the Applicant shall be entitled to a building permit for construction which, when completed, will result in the total square footage of all of the buildings on the subject property being greater than what Subsection B of this section would allow but not greater than the average.

Nothing in this section shall relieve the applicant
from satisfying all of the other requirements of this chapter and
all of the requirements of every other law that must be satisfied
before the Town's Building Department may issue a building permit.
Applicability of this section.

This section shall apply only to a lot whose
principal use is a one- or a two-family dwelling.
Exceptions.

A lot shall not be in violation of this section
if the total square footage of all of the buildings on that lot will
be greater than the maximum permitted total square footage allowed
for that lot because of construction done or to be done pursuant to
a building permit issued prior to the effective date of this section.

Assuming that there is compliance with all other
requirements for the issuance of a building permit, a building permit
shall be issued during the first 90 days after this section goes into
effect for construction based upon building plans that shall have
been filed with the Building Department before the effective date
of this section even though no building permit shall have been issued
before the effective date of this section and, upon completion of
such construction, the total square footage of all of the buildings
on that lot will be greater than the maximum permitted total square
footage allowed for that lot. Starting on the 91st day after the effective
date of this section, building plans filed with the Building Department
prior to the effective date of this section shall no longer be exempt
from the application of this section.

This section shall not apply to any lot for
which:

An application for a variance shall have been
filed prior to the effective date of this section; provided that such
application either shall have appeared on the agenda of a meeting
of the Board of Appeals held prior to the effective date of this section
or is scheduled to appear on the agenda for the first meeting of the
Board of Appeals after the effective date of this section; or

An application for an approval and/or a permit
from the Planning Board shall have been filed prior to the effective
date of this section; provided such application either shall have
appeared on the agenda of a meeting of the Planning Board held prior
to the effective date of this section or is scheduled to appear on
the agenda for the first meeting of the Planning Board after the effective
date of this section.

This section shall apply to any lot for which
an interpretation of the Zoning Ordinance is being requested from
the Board of Appeals.

An attic which exists on the effective date
of this section and is not legally permitted to be used as habitable
space (as that term is defined in the New York State Building Code
in effect on January 1, 2003) can be converted to habitable space
even though, upon completion of the conversion, the maximum permitted
total square footage for all of the buildings on the subject property
will exceed the maximum permitted total square footage allowed for
that lot so long as after the conversion, the exterior walls of the
building in which such attic is located remain in the same position
and the sum of the horizontal length of all of the alterations in
the roof line on a side of the building is no longer than 1/4 of the
horizontal length of the wall beneath such roof on that side of the
building.

A seasonal porch may be permanently enclosed
even though upon completion of that work, the maximum total square
footage for all of the buildings on the subject property will exceed
the maximum permitted total square footage allowed for that lot so
long as neither the exterior of the seasonal porch nor the exterior
walls of the dwelling to which the seasonal porch is attached are
relocated closer to the lot lines of the subject property after the
permanent enclosure is completed.
